title: Best app for automatic Wi-Fi management
comment: I just downloaded this app, so I'll update my rating once I've tested it further, but I did my fair share of research regarding apps to automatically shut my phone's Wi-Fi functionality off when I'm not home, and Wi-Fi Matic is by far the most straightforward and well-designed of them all. It does exactly what it was built for, and it does only that, no unnecessary fluff to be found. Hopefully having multiple commonly used access points won't throw it off; I guess only time will tell!

title: Doesn't work on my HTC1
comment: (Update. Tried this a second time. No improvement. WiFi stays on all the time.) Does NOT work as described. All it does is keep my WiFi on all the time, draining my battery. Nothing more. I emailed the developer for help and he sent a nasty, unhelpful response complaining about my rating rather than helping me. His response below doesnt apply because my WiFi never turned off no matter where I was. Bottom line is program doesn't do what it's supposed to on my phone. It may work on others but not mine.

My response applies to your complaint. Turning off wifi after leaving cell tower area where your hotspot is located is nominal use case of Wi-Fi matic and it works (check other comments...) as long as you actually leave that area and you cross the boundary. Check my second email for details.

title: A question...
comment: I would like to know how exactly the "Near a Wi-Fi" area (yellow area) is computed...  If I have, for example, three cell towers near my wifi, do I need to detect each of them to toggle my Wi-Fi on, or do I have to detect only one of them ? In other words, is the yellow area the intersection of each cell area or the sum of all the cell areas ? Thank you very much for your help !
Bit flakey. Not useful cos it doesnt allow my extender so keeps going out of range right at my home!
Works Great!!

Love this app, put it on every new phone I buy! REALLY saves battery on any phone. If WiFi is on, the internal radio in your phone is constantly checking for a Wi-Fi signal. This takes power, and a lot of it. This app is smart and simple... it quickly learns your access points, home, work, coffee shop, etc. By using cell tower triangulation: meaning no GPS used. If you help it along learning your access points it it's quicker, but it will figure them out on it's own fairly quickly. Try it and see!

title: Fantastic Support by Dev
comment: App works great!  For best performance, manually disconnect and reconnect Wi-Fi several times when setting up a new location so that it picks up all available towers in the area.  I promise this app does not disappoint.

Hi. 

First you have to manually configure your Wi-Fi connection so Wi-Fi Matic can learn its location. After that it will take care of toggling Wi-Fi on and off as you move inside/outside of the area. 

It processes cell tower id changes besides of periodically checking location every 15 min. Drop me an email and I'll give you details.

Regards.

Hello Quincy. The way it works is as follows: you need to setup connection for the first time manually so it can learn that wifi location. After that it will take care of toggling wifi on and off when required. It needs to have enough mobile network coverage to know where it is.

title: Best battery saving app
comment: Use your phone like a real smart phone, its great to have the wifi turned off automatically when out of the wifi range while scheduling it off at sleeping times a great feature.  If it adds auto sync on and off with a timer setting, and schedule with a screen filter/darkness controll then it can beat any battery saving app in market at the moment.  5 ***** Star  Thanks a bundle for a neat and to the mark app.

title: Perfect.
comment: Except that there should be a preference where the Wi-Fi should stay off even when in a registered Wi-Fi zone if it's been disabled manually through Android settings.

title: Automatic WiFi at its best.

title: ***** Activate & Deactivate
comment: Just the job - works a treat. Sometimes I need to go into the app. and switch off then on the WiFi, so a big improvement would be a deactivate & activate button on the home screen. *****

title: Almost Perfect
comment: Runs flawlessly on my XPERIA X8 phone running FroyoBread. The only problem is that a Base Transmitter scope is much too broad, so that sometimes it turns on my Wi-Fi even though I'm around 1 km from the intended Wi-Fi AP
